intro: Hyptianthera macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited hyptianthera, is a small shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
